author: Thomas Barrabi
title: Warren Buffett’s wife grumbles about $4 coffee at Sun Valley
description: Warren Buffett's wife was overheard at Allen & Co's annual "summer camp for billionaires" complaining to a resort staffer about having to pay $4 for a cup of coffee.

author: Jason Claffey
title: Prospective Brunswick café owner defends crowdfunding campaign
description: Raffi Sulahian, who is trying to open a café at the former Little Dog Coffee Shop, also addressed a letter he wrote slamming the shop's union.

author: Miriam Schwartz
title: Hot Property: Penthouse provides stunning views
description: We’ve found the epitome of refined city living in a sun-drenched penthouse duplex at 350 Columbus Avenue, Unit 6. The distinctive, sought-after red facade endemic of South End/Back Bay architecture brings with it the location’s many (many, many) attractions, including tons of nearby restaurants, coffee shops, and local hangouts. title: Tony has made 150,000 coffees in five years from this cart. Now council is banning it

title: Home Country: Passing the time with Windy
description: It was Windy Wilson’s turn, unofficially, of course, to pick a coffee counter topic of learned truth and everlasting beauty. title: Plans for major coffee shop's return go cold
description: Plans for a major coffee chain’s return to Chichester city centre appear to have gone cold.

author: Dana Cadey
title: Javastop cafe receives notice to comply over signage
description: Longmont’s Javastop coffee shop on Monday was served a notice to comply by its landlord over a claim of unapproved signs displayed outside of the business's rented space.

title: Neighbourly Coffee offers ‘leg up’ for people who were once unhoused
description: A recently-opened coffee shop is a social enterprise created by 12 Neighbours, which has established 63 subsidized tiny homes on a designated plot of land in Fredericton.

title: Asa Hutchinson Makes Pitch as Bigger Names and Personalities Crowd Him Out
description: Over pizzas or coffee, former Gov. Asa Hutchinson of Arkansas is talking to Iowans, six or eight at a time, in a fight to get into the Republican debates and stay in the race.
